TopicTitle: Trying to find the old orbital lab that was the size of the hitchhiker container

Articles.Content:
Hey, folks - just a quick question...

Back when I was first playing KSP, I was dumb and actually took apart the files out of their respective folders and put them in the plugin folder, much like was required for the old SimCity4 game (yeah, who needs to read the FAQs and other documentation, right?). Well, to make a long story short, I was cleaning up and reinstalling the mods the correct way (GameData folder this time!) as per the many forum discussions and readme files said to do (game works a lot better )

I cannot seem to find the original mod that had the hitchhiker container that held four Kerbals AND had the science lab with it (3m part) that was the same height. Anyone know where I can find it? I originally downloaded it from the KSP site when it had the exchange...

Thanks!

Would it be this one?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43840-Hab-Hub-%28and-other-strange-things%29

Scroll down a bit, after the radiators

I'm not sure, but I think that part is also present on KSP Interstellar

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43839-0-23-5-KSP-Interstellar-%28Toolbar-Integration-New-Models-New-Tech%29-Version-0-11

Would it be this one?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43840-Hab-Hub-%28and-other-strange-things%29

Scroll down a bit, after the radiators

I'm not sure, but I think that part is also present on KSP Interstellar

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/43839-0-23-5-KSP-Interstellar-%28Toolbar-Integration-New-Models-New-Tech%29-Version-0-11

Thiagobs,

Nope, I checked out both links and did not see the original station science lab. If I recall, it had room for three kerbals and was the exact size of the hitch hiker module that fits four kerbals. Thanks anyway, and because of your help, I did find a replacement for what I lost!

Was it the taurus command pod?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75074-24-x-Taurus-HCV-3-75-m-Crew-Pod-and-other-parts-v1-2-1-July-22-2014
